Title: 15 079 PROVISION OF SUPPORT AND INTELLIGENCE – COLLECTION OF BUSINESS RATES
Description:
Cheshire East Council as the third biggest unitary Authority in the North West and has approximately 13,400 commercial premises with a combined rateable value (RV) of £342M and a collectible debit of c. £135M.
From April 2013 new provisions were applied under the Governments Localism agenda for the retention of Business Rates. Cheshire East Borough Council therefore require the services from a Service Provider to carry out a review of our Business Rates list and to help with the identification of additional Business Rates.
The service required from the Service Provider is to identify additional Rateable Value (RV) in the rating list. This could include businesses where RV values are too low (business has changed, expanded etc) or where new businesses are not included in the current rating list, and will increase RV for the Authority. This will maximise income through the collection of Business Rates from the additional RV once the District Valuer has revalued/valued the premises.
Further information and responses must be submitted via the Chest: www.the-chest.org.uk

Title: Business Rate Revenue Forecasting and Income Maximisation Service
Description:
There is a requirement to complete the government returns which requires the Council to estimate the impact of outstanding rateable value appeals on its estimated income.  \r
\r
The Council needs to understand and calculate its future income risk in terms of reductions in rateable values. \r
\r
The provider will analyse the outstanding business rates appeals data and provide the Council with a comprehensive review and report of potential changes to rateable values and loss of income for both retrospective and future changes. This should be available on a case by case basis and include the valuation category, financial year and individual property details, where appropriate.

Title: Business Rates Forecasting - AWARD
Description:
Business Rates Forecasting
      
      Business Rates localisation presents a variety of challenges for local authorities in relation to the calculation and forecasting of the various elements of the business rates retention scheme.  As an authority participating in the rates retention pilot scheme in Sandwell we currently retain 100% of the income generated through Business Rates.  
      
      It is crucial that we are able to manage our rating list effectively, forecast changes which may affect net collectable debit and maximise growth through the early identification of commercial properties in the area.
      
      Rates avoidance is a serious concern especially in the current climate and it is important that efforts are made to validate reductions applied as much as possible.  In Sandwell large numbers of hereditaments receive Small Business Rates Relief but this will no longer apply if a company/organisation has more than one business in the same name.  
      
      Sandwell MBC therefore require a company who can provide:
      o Revenues Forecasting
      o RV Finder
      o Small Business Rates Relief Audit
      
      The contract duration is for 4 years from 14 April 2020 - 13 April 2024.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the ITT and other related documents.
      
      In Order To View the documents and Submit a Tender, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810.
      
      Closing date: Tuesday 18 February 2020 at 12:00 noon.

Title: Business Rate Maximisation
Description:
The Council is seeking a contractor that can undertake Business Rate maximisation work on its behalf which will involve accessing a wide range of sources to identify missing properties and undervalued assessments and the provision of a hosted service that accurately monitors rateable value, estimates the effect on outstanding proposals and case manages reported cases reported cases. The successful contractor will have rating expertise to provide technical support where required.in this process and liaise with the VOA.  
The opportunity is available on the London Tenders Portal at the following link: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=89a2aac1-1f24-e611-8114-000c29c9ba21
